sense.name: a military aircraft that drops ordinance
sense.examples: The heavy bombers made daylight runs over Berlin. The enemy radar could not detect the stealth bombers. The Japanese used dive bombers in WWII against the U.S. navy.

sense.name: a person who plants or detonates explosives
sense.examples: A suicide bomber blew herself up in front of a Tel Aviv restaurant, killing five. They are trying to recruit bombers from the ranks of unemployed young men living in cities. This device would suggest that the bomber is a well trained explosives engineer.

sense.name: a big sandwich with many ingredients, a sub or hero
sense.examples: Mary could only eat half of her bomber. That Italian cafe makes the best bombers in town. Their bomber has three kinds of meat, two kinds of cheese, lettuce, pickles and tomato.

sense.name: a leather jacket, modeled after those of military pilots
sense.examples: The discount store had racks of overcoats and bombers. Sally paid three hundred dollars for her fleece-lined bomber. A lot of black and brown bombers were seen on the runways of Paris and Milan this season.

sense.name: a cigarette with marijuana mixed in
sense.examples: The rock star smokes a bomber before each performance. The Customs officer found a bomber in John's pocket.
